metadata.Title: CVE-2023-0494 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was found in X.Org. This issue occurs due to a danglingpointer in DeepCopyPointerClasses that can be exploited byProcXkbSetDeviceInfo() and ProcXkbGetDeviceInfo() to read and write intofreed memory. This can lead to local privilege elevation on systems wherethe X server runs privileged and remote code execution for ssh X forwardingsessions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-0494` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

xdmx - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1~20.04.6
xdmx-tools - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1~20.04.6
xnest - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1~20.04.6
xorg-server-source - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1~20.04.6
xserver-common - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1~20.04.6
xserver-xephyr - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1~20.04.6
xserver-xorg-core - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1~20.04.6
xserver-xorg-legacy - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1~20.04.6
xvfb - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1~20.04.6
xwayland - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1~20.04.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xorg-server package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1~20.04.6').
